description:
Lumafield helps engineering teams work at the speed of light. Lumafield's Voyager analysis software and Atlas AI co-pilot find answers quickly and facilitate collaboration. Lumafield's Neptune industrial CT scanner arms engineers with X-ray vision, allowing them to look inside their products, inspect invisible features, and pinpoint problems before they reach customers.

Founded in 2019, our team includes world-class researchers and industrial designers, PhDs, founders of successful startups, and zero egos.

The company is headquartered in Boston, MA and has an office in San Francisco, CA.
description_metadata_raw: Accelerate product development with the Neptune industrial X-ray CT scanner, Voyager analysis software, and Atlas AI co-pilot for manufacturing.

Every drop of fuel entering an engine passes through a fuel injector. These small valves open and close thousands of times per minute, spraying fuel in a precise mist that blends with air for combustion. When that spray is consistent the engine run smoothly, efficiently, and with full power.

Follow the link to learn more about casted auto parts like this: https://lnkd.in/gdqQqZni

Fuel injectors are precision nozzles that feed your engine with (you guessed it) fuel. By spraying fuel in a fine, controlled mist, they create a mix with air for combustion. This refined balance is what makes modern engines more efficient and reduce emissions.  

Follow the link to learn more about casted auto parts like this: https://lnkd.in/eAuQZC_t

#ct  #xray #cars #engine #fuelinjector

The throttle body in a car controls how much air enters with every press of the pedal. A clean, responsive valve means smooth airflow and balanced combustion, but when carbon builds up or the valve sticks, the engine can respond poorly with hesitation, rough idle, and possibly lose power entirely. 

Check out the link to learn more about casted auto parts like this: https://lnkd.in/eRbDjcNP

The throttle body in a car decides how much air your engine takes in. Inside is a butterfly valve that pivots with every press of the pedal. When it's working normally, airflow is steady and combustion stays balanced, but if carbon builds or something happens to the actuating motor, hesitation and loss of power are a possibility.


Follow the link to learn more about casted auto parts like this: https://lnkd.in/gdqQqZni

Alloy Enterprises Inc is upgrading the way they validate their Stack Forging manufacturing process for AMD and NVIDIA GPU cold plates with CT scans. Being able to see the complex microcapillaries not only verifies their construction, but allows for an easy to understand way to share findings with others. 

Bonus: the scans are gorgeous too ü§©
company_updates.reshared_post_description:
What does it take to cool an industry-leading AI chip?

Here‚Äôs a CT scan revealing our microcapillary architecture inside one of our cold plates, purpose-built for AMD's MI300 GPU - and it‚Äôs not your average microchannel.

What you're seeing:
Microcapillaries ‚Üí a precisely engineered network of microchannels, hierarchically optimized across multiple length scales to squeeze out every watt of heat, while minimizing pressure drop.

Why it matters:
Compared to an industry-leading competitor, Alloy Enterprises Inc microcapillary architecture delivers: 
üßä 11X lower pressure drop
üî• 57% lower thermal resistance 
That‚Äôs the difference between a bottlenecked GPU and full-throttle AI performance.

Here‚Äôs the kicker: 
This level of thermal performance is impossible to fabricate without Stack Forging. This scan isn‚Äôt just eye candy - it‚Äôs proof captured with our @Lumafield Neptune Scanner.

Want to learn more?
Reach out ‚Üí
info@alloyenterprises.co

Check out our feature with Lumafield ‚Üí https://lnkd.in/enX4_Xat

company_updates.reshared_post_description:
Episode 380 of¬†The VentureFizz #Podcast¬†features¬†Eduardo Torrealba, CEO & Co-Founder of¬†Lumafield: https://lnkd.in/e7NvWJFp.

As part of my conversation with Eduardo, we talk about the importance of working on hard things. Yes, it‚Äôs hard to build things that seem impossible at the time but it is that level of difficulty that attracts the top talent across engineering and other functional areas to join the company. And, it is that level of difficulty that once you establish product market fit, it can been highly defensible and really difficult to copy. And, it is that level of difficulty that attracts the best investors to fund a company with the hopes that it can be an industry defining company, especially when there is hardware involved.

Take Lumafield, a pioneering developer of accessible X-ray CT technology, recently¬†announced a $75M Series C round of funding¬†led by IVP, along with new investors G2 Venture Partners and Wellington Management and previous investors Spark Capital, Lux Capital, Kleiner Perkins, DCVC, and Matter Venture Partners, and angel investors like Tony Fadell ‚Äì yes that Tony Fadell, the inventor of the iPod and Founder of Nest.

In this episode of our podcast, we cover:

* Eduardo‚Äôs background story and his initial journey into entrepreneurship with an IoT soil moisture sensor company called Oso Technologies.
* Joining Formlabs and what he worked on in the earlier days of the company and what he learned during the company‚Äôs growth to a billion dollar valuation.
* The full story of Lumafield in terms of how the team came together (Ric Fulop, Andreas Bastian, Kevin Cedrone, Scott Johnston, Jonathan Aharon) and the problem they are solving.
* The fundraising process and the current state of the company, plus future plans ahead.
* Lessons learned from building companies and raising capital.
* The importance of a strong company pitch.
* And so much more

Episode Sponsor:

As a longtime champion of the local startup ecosystem, SVB supports innovative companies with the solutions and financing they need through every stage of growth. description:
Niron Magnetics is reshaping American manufacturing. We saw the problems caused by rare earth dependence and took a fundamentally different approach, reconceptualizing how magnets can be made. Our groundbreaking Iron Nitride technology was born at the University of Minnesota, then developed and manufactured right here in Minnesota.

The result is a more secure and sustainable supply chain, and a material that unlocks innovation in magnet-using devices. With facilities clean enough to sit in the heart of cities, and our world-class team of experts, we are creating the future of magnetics.

company_updates.description:
Niron Magnetics was honored to be invited as a partner to the Defense Logistics Agency's R&D Strategic Materials Launch Party at Fort Belvoir this week.

Being selected as one of only six companies for their exclusive showcase was truly a privilege. The program launch focused on strengthening America's strategic materials supply chains: critical work for our national and economic security.

We are excited to continue our collaboration in building more resilient supply chains for strategic materials with our rare-earth-free powerful permanent magnets.

#DefenseLogistics #StrategicMaterials #NationalSecurity #DLA #Partnership

As demand for electric motors surges, the global reliance on rare-earth magnets presents a serious challenge. It‚Äôs clear that a more sustainable, efficient alternative is needed.
¬†
Drive System Design‚Äôs inverter control expertise, alongside Alvier Mechatronics‚Äô end-to-end motor design, is enabling the integration of high-performance Iron Nitride magnets from Niron Magnetics, Inc. into fully rare-earth-free electric motors.
¬†
Together, we‚Äôre proving that the future of electrification doesn‚Äôt have to be constrained by resource scarcity. We‚Äôre forging a new path.

#RareEarth #RareEarthFree #Powertrain #eMobility #MotorDesign #TechForGood #DesignforSustainability #Innovation

Our CTO, Frank Johnson, was invited to speak at the Domestic Critical Minerals and Materials Supply Chains workshop, hosted by the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE)‚Äôs Critical Materials Collaborative.

The workshop will explore DOE‚Äôs critical minerals and materials programs and showcase exemplary projects advancing key technologies and processes. Frank will join other featured speakers from across DOE offices and DOE-funded initiatives, with discussions highlighting the vital role critical minerals and materials play in achieving American energy leadership and maintaining global competitiveness.

Thank you, Advanced Research Projects Agency-Energy (ARPA-E), for your continued support in advancing this important work!

company_updates.description:
We‚Äôre proud to share that Jonathan Burke, our Director of Business Development, took home Best Early Stage Company at the pitch competition during the 17th Annual Ground Vehicle Systems Engineering & Technology Symposium (#GVSETS)!

GVSETS brings together leaders from government, academia, and industry to drive the transformation and modernization of ground vehicle systems. With global threats becoming more aggressive and complex, we‚Äôre excited to share how Niron Magnetics‚Äô Iron Nitride permanent magnet technology is helping to drive resilient, cutting-edge solutions that strengthen defense capabilities for the future.

Thank you to #GVSETS for the recognition and to all participants for making this such an impactful event.

Catch Jonathan Burke, our Director of Business Development, at #GVSETS today! He‚Äôs presenting at the Pitch Event at 2:00pm and will be sharing how Niron Magnetics is innovating rare-earth-free permanent magnets to power the next generation of advanced manufacturing.

Don‚Äôt miss this opportunity to learn about the next generation of solutions driving defense capability forward!
company_updates.reshared_post_description:
The wait is over. 

GVSETS is here.

The nation‚Äôs only symposium 100% focused on military ground vehicles and Army modernization.

3,000+ attendees.
200+ exhibitors.

This is where innovation meets mission readiness.

company_updates.description:
We‚Äôre excited to be attending the 17th Annual #GVSETS next week! The Niron Magnetics team will be onsite connecting with innovators and industry leaders driving the future of ground vehicle systems and defense tech.

GVSETS is a key defense industry event focused on the deliberate transformation and modernization of ground vehicle systems to address evolving global threats. It brings together government, academia, and industry leaders to collaborate on delivering next-generation solutions that enhance warfighter capabilities.

If you‚Äôre attending, pass by GVSETS' Pitch Event and learn how our Iron Nitride permanent magnets are helping deliver resilient, next-generation solutions for defense innovation.

We‚Äôre honored to be featured in the latest National Association of Manufacturers - NAM newsletter following a recent visit from House Majority Whip Tom Emmer.

During his visit to our Minneapolis facility, Whip Emmer met with our team, got a firsthand look at our manufacturing processes, and even hand-pressed one of our Iron Nitride permanent magnets. We also had the opportunity to talk about why permanent magnets are a strategic chokepoint for both national security and US manufacturing, and how Niron Magnetics‚Äô domestic alternative can help secure the supply chain and enable the next generation of critical technologies.

We're proud to be one of the American manufacturers leading the way on innovation, resilience, and reindustrialization. Thank you to NAM for your ongoing advocacy and for highlighting our work at this critical moment for American manufacturing.

Read the full newsletter in the comments!

We‚Äôre just weeks away from the 2025 Emerging Technologies for Defense Conference in Washington, DC!

Our rare-earth-free Iron Nitride magnets are powering advancements in everything from motors to speakers. As a Supporting Sponsor for the conference, we‚Äôre excited to showcase how we can meet the demands of next-generation defense technologies, delivering high performance without the supply chain risks of traditional rare earth materials.

Hosted by the National Defense Industrial Association - (NDIA)‚Äôs ETI | Emerging Technologies Institute, the event gathers top decision-makers from across the defense innovation ecosystem. We‚Äôre proud to be part of the conversation.

Stop by our booth (#7656) to see what we‚Äôre bringing to the future of defense.

Last week, we were honored to welcome US Congressman Raja Krishnamoorthi (IL-08) to our Minneapolis facility!

As Ranking Member of the House Select Committee on Strategic Competition Between the United States and the Chinese Communist Party, Rep. Krishnamoorthi is deeply engaged in efforts to strengthen domestic supply chains and reduce US reliance on foreign critical materials.

During his visit, he saw firsthand how Niron Magnetics‚Äô rare-earth-free Iron Nitride magnet technology is at the forefront of supporting those efforts with our 100% domestically-sourced and manufactured magnets.

Thank you, Congressman Krishnamoorthi, for your leadership on economic and national security issues, and for taking the time to see our Minnesota base for American innovation in action.

In case you missed it, CNBC featured Niron in their deep dive into how China‚Äôs sudden rare-earths export restrictions in April this year sent shockwaves through the global auto industry.

The segment explored how the move by Beijing exposed critical supply chain vulnerabilities, and how the industry might prevent having to face a similar scenario again. Our CEO Jonathan Rowntree was interviewed as part of CNBC‚Äôs exploration of innovative alternatives to rare earth dependency. He explained how we offer a fundamentally different path forward:

‚ÄúOur magnets are made out of iron and nitrogen, which means you can stand up a plant anywhere in the world.‚Äù

The report perfectly captures why the shift from rare earths matters for America's manufacturing resilience and energy independence now more than ever. And, as Gracelin Baskaran, PhD from the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) emphasized, making the shift is a fully attainable goal, saying: "We'll leverage innovation to need less rare earths, and that's one of America's strong points."

Take a minute to watch the piece to discover more on why we do what we do at Niron, and how we‚Äôre helping to secure vital industries as a result.

https://lnkd.in/e7Z6cSBF

Link to the full CNBC report in the comments.

Thanks to everyone who has voted so far, and there‚Äôs still time to help us advance in the ‚ÄúCoolest Thing Made in Minnesota‚Äù competition!

Our rare-earth-free Iron Nitride magnets are competing in the first round, and every vote counts. Public voting is open until September 7, and the products with the most votes will move forward to the next round.

Let‚Äôs keep the momentum going and show why Iron Nitride magnets are the future of resilient, sustainable manufacturing!

Show your support and vote for Niron Magnetics here: https://lnkd.in/eQAs8P2r

A couple of weeks ago, our CEO Jonathan Rowntree had the honor of speaking at the University of Minnesota‚Äôs ‚Äú120+ UMN Startups since 2020: A Celebration of Impact & Innovation.‚Äù

The event showcased the incredible pace of innovation coming out of UMN and the startups transforming both Minnesota‚Äôs economy and lives around the world. Jonathan shared Niron Magnetics‚Äô journey, from an idea born in a UMN lab to developing rare-earth-free Iron Nitride permanent magnets that are redefining supply chain resilience and powering next-gen technologies.

It was an inspiring morning alongside leaders including Congressman Tom Emmer and UMN President Rebecca Cunningham, celebrating the state‚Äôs role as a national leader in research-driven innovation.

We‚Äôre proud to be part of this thriving ecosystem and excited for what‚Äôs next. Check out some images below and read more about the event in the comments!

We‚Äôre excited to share that Niron Magnetics' Iron Nitride permanent magnets made it into the Top 64 entries in the ‚ÄúCoolest Thing Made in Minnesota‚Äù competition!

This recognition highlights the innovation, quality, and impact of our work, and now, we need your support.

The first round of public voting is now open and runs through September 7. Each round is a head-to-head matchup, and advancing depends entirely on your votes.

Help us show the world why Iron Nitride magnets are the future and vote for us here: https://lnkd.in/eQAs8P2r

It‚Äôs the final day of the 2025 Emerging Technologies for Defense Conference!

We‚Äôve had an incredible week connecting with leaders across the defense innovation ecosystem and sharing how our Iron Nitride magnets bring performance and resilience to national security tech.

Thanks to National Defense Industrial Association - (NDIA) and the ETI | Emerging Technologies Institute for bringing everyone together. We hope to see you next year!

Day 2 of the 2025 Emerging Technologies for Defense Conference is underway, and we are just getting started!

Yesterday, we were honored to host Mr. Emil Michael, U.S. Under Secretary of Defense for Research & Engineering, at our booth to discuss how Niron Magnetics‚Äô rare-earth-free Iron Nitride magnets can help build resilient supply chains for next-gen defense systems.

If you‚Äôre attending, stop by booth #7656 to connect with the Niron Magnetics team.

Check out some highlights below!

Yesterday, the President called on the nation to end its import reliance and become self-sufficient in permanent magnets.

Niron Magnetics is doing just that. Our groundbreaking magnet technology leverages America‚Äôs strong materials resources to produce powerful rare-earth-free permanent magnets. And we are scaling production to meet U.S. defense and commercial demand at an unprecedented pace.

Link to a story covering the President's remarks in the comments.

We are here at the 2025 Emerging Technologies for Defense Conference in Washington, DC! 

We will be on the ground and ready to talk about the critical role rare-earth-free Iron Nitride magnets can play in powering next-generation defense systems. 

If you‚Äôre at the conference, stop by booth #7656 to connect with the Niron Magnetics team and learn how we‚Äôre building supply chain resilience into the materials that matter most.

We are proud to announce that we have finalized our agreement with the City Of Sartell to bring Niron Magnetics‚Äô first commercial permanent magnet manufacturing facility to Central Minnesota, a major milestone as we scale up production of our rare-earth-free Iron Nitride permanent magnets.

We are proud to be joining a community that values innovation, manufacturing, and a strong local workforce. Sartell represents the next chapter in our growth and we are thrilled to officially call it home.

company_updates.description:
Niron Magnetics is a finalist for the 2025 Manufacturing Leadership Awards in Sustainability and the Circular Economy!

This recognition highlights our Iron Nitride manufacturing process that recycles 80% of water and 97% of hydrogen while enabling full recycling of our magnets through existing scrap iron streams. By eliminating the need for rare earth elements and creating a closed-loop manufacturing system, we're proving that sustainable technology can deliver exceptional performance without compromising environmental responsibility.

We‚Äôre honored to be named an #MLAwards Finalist and are looking forward to the Manufacturing Leadership Awards Gala in Florida on June 18! Manufacturing Leadership Council

Rare earth minerals and magnets have been a growing topic of interest in the U.S. supply chain lately. This highlights the importance of strengthening America's supply chain for magnets.

"Our company was founded to address the reality that most magnetic materials today come from outside the country," explained CTO Frank Johnson at the recent Advanced Research Projects Agency-Energy (ARPA-E) Energy Innovation Summit. "That's why we're commercializing the world's most powerful non-rare-earth permanent magnet material made from Iron Nitride, which doesn't contain any critical minerals."

Our Iron Nitride magnets are a domestically produced alternative that eliminates dependence on foreign rare earth supply chains. By using abundant materials and advanced manufacturing techniques, our Iron Nitride magnets can help build America‚Äôs supply chain resilience and support the growth of the automotive, consumer electronics, and defense industries.

As global supply chains evolve, Niron Magnetics stands ready to partner with manufacturers seeking sustainable magnetic solutions made in the USA.
Grateful for the opportunity to collaborate with community and state leaders as we grow our presence in Sartell. We're excited about the road ahead and the impact we can make together!

company_updates.description:
There has been an increasing national focus on securing rare earth elements, which are essential components for the permanent magnets that power many of our modern devices and machines. While strategies such as exploring new rare earth sources and advancing recycling efforts are important, we need to support the development of alternative technologies that don‚Äôt rely on rare earth elements.

The U.S. needs to continue investment in alternative technologies to reduce dependency on rare earth permanent magnets, and our iron nitride magnets are one such solution. Made from locally abundant and affordable materials like iron and nitrogen, these high-performance magnets eliminate the need for rare earth elements entirely.

As the demand for permanent magnets continues to grow across industries such as electronics, telecommunications, robotics, and defense, iron nitride magnets are a smart, economically viable solution that supports a more resilient U.S. economy.

The Niron team started January at #CES2025, and is wrapping up the month with our former CEO, Andy Blackburn, joining a panel at the 2025 Cleantech Group Forum in San Diego!

Andy will join Wednesday‚Äôs panel on ‚ÄúA Health Check on North American Energy Materials,‚Äù discussing the U.S.'s five-year progress in efforts to reduce reliance on China for critical materials. The conversation will focus on initiatives driving domestic production, innovation in extraction and recycling, and the growth of new manufacturing facilities (like ours) across the country.

Minneapolis/St. Paul Business Journal (MSPBJ) shared our exciting news about receiving a $52 million federal tax credit award to build our rare-earth-free magnet manufacturing plant in Sartell. This project is a big step toward securing domestic supply chains, advancing sustainable tech, and bolstering Minnesotan innovation!

Over forty years ago, General Motors invented the neodymium permanent magnet, a breakthrough in materials science that enabled energy efficiency and performance across multiple industries. These high-performance permanent magnets have become a necessity in our daily lives, powering everything from vehicles and medical devices to smartphones and speakers.

Today, these magnets are ubiquitous‚Äîyet most people are unaware of the looming supply chain crisis they face. Adamas Intelligence projects global demand for permanent magnets will roughly triple by 2035, and supply chains are struggling to keep pace. With nearly 90% of rare earth magnets produced overseas, we're confronting a technological bottleneck that threatens anything that contains magnets. 

At Niron Magnetics, we've innovated around traditional rare-earth permanent magnet production constraints. Our iron nitride magnet technology represents the next step in permanent magnet development‚Äîa high-performance alternative that eliminates rare earth dependencies while maintaining exceptional magnetic properties. By using readily available iron and nitrogen and advanced manufacturing techniques, we're creating iron nitride magnets with zero critical mineral content, superior thermal stability, and a dramatically reduced environmental footprint. 

This year marks an exciting milestone for Niron. We'll break ground on the world's first vertically integrated full-scale manufacturing plant for rare-earth-free powerful permanent magnets in the United States. This facility, located in Sartell, Minnesota, represents a domestic and scalable solution to the growing demand for permanent magnets. By establishing domestic production capabilities, Niron will help reduce the United States‚Äô reliance on foreign sources of magnets and increase our country‚Äôs supply chain resilience for critical materials needed for a safe and innovative future.

As we stand on the shoulders of GM's 1984 breakthrough, we're committed to enabling a more technologically resilient future. The path forward demands all available alternatives, each contributing unique strengths to solving our global permanent magnet challenges. Therefore, the next 40 years of technological innovation will be defined by our ability to scale domestic production of high-performance permanent magnets. 

At Niron, we're not just watching that future unfold‚Äîwe're actively creating it. Stay tuned for what we accomplish in 2025!

Thank you to the Niron Magnetics employees who volunteered last week with Junior Achievement! Giving back to our community and supporting education are important to our organization, and the JA Finance Park program was a great way to get involved and live our values.

Participating in JA Finance Park helps bring positive and measurable change to the youth of our community. Not only did we provide valuable information and guidance to the students last week, but we also all had our own learning and growth opportunities. ‚ÄúInvesting in tomorrow‚Äôs leaders today‚Äù through active involvement and positive influence is a vital part of building a brighter future for us all, and we‚Äôre proud to work with Junior Achievement North in achieving this mission.

Today marks a major milestone in U.S. manufacturing independence as we announce our award of $52 million to advance the construction of the world‚Äôs only manufacturing facility of powerful, rare-earth-free permanent magnets in Sartell, Minnesota. This award is provided through the Section 48C Advanced Energy Project tax credit program.

Our magnets, made from the most magnetic material known to science‚Äîiron nitride‚Äîoffer a sustainable solution to the increasing demand for permanent magnets. By leveraging locally available materials and cutting-edge manufacturing processes, our new facility will reduce reliance on imported materials and secure domestic supply chains. 

https://lnkd.in/ghRwrYig

Read all of January's technology news in one place with the newest Breakthrough Technologies newsletter. This edition features interviews and insights from Oak Ridge National Laboratory, Kore Infrastructure, Niron Magnetics, Inc., Puraffinity, University of Bayreuth, SINTEF and more

It‚Äôs time to wrap up #CES2025! 

We had a great time meeting everyone who came out to our booth and enjoyed showing off our rockin‚Äô guitar made with Clean Earth Magnet¬Æ technology (huge thank you to ARPA-E). Our magnets aren‚Äôt just changing music and motors, they play an important role in ensuring the stability and promoting the advancement of modern technology. 

See you next year!

Another amazing day at #CES2025! Come by our booth at ARPA-E (LVCC North Hall #8953) to learn more about how Clean Earth Magnet¬Æ technology is advancing industries like music, vehicles, electronics, and more. We‚Äôre looking forward to another great day ahead! #SustainableInnovation #TechForGood #CES2025

What an incredible start to #CES2025! Day 1 was a success, and we‚Äôre just getting started. Don‚Äôt miss out on your chance to check out the world‚Äôs first guitar made with Clean Earth Magnet¬Æ technology pickups at our booth at ARPA-E (LVCC North Hall #8953). 

We‚Äôre excited to keep sharing our mission for sustainable technology and the future of magnets. See you soon!

description:
Limiting global warming to 1.5¬∞C implies reaching net zero CO2 emissions in 2050 according to the IPCC. Next to substantially reducing emissions, this target will only be possible by globally deploying carbon removal (CDR) solutions at the scale of billions of tons of CO2. Neustark is a leading provider in this rapidly growing field, having developed a solution to permanently store CO2 from the air in recycled mineral waste such as demolished concrete. 

Our first solutions have been deployed in Switzerland and Europe and are already capturing and storing tons of CO2 every week. We are currently scaling up our operations and carbon removal impact globally ‚Äì on the road to removing one million tons of CO2 in 2030, and beyond that. 

Founded in 2019, neustark AG is based in Berne, Switzerland, and is a team of around 55 people (as per Q3 2023) working at our Berne, Zurich and Cologne offices. Together, we enable permanent CO2 storage for a bright future of all generations on our planet.

What we do in a nutshell: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=joVBNV9O2MA
description_enriched: The company works with construction and demolition waste recyclers, urban miners, slag and iba processors, concrete producers, co‚ÇÇ sources, and businesses with climate targets. They remove CO‚ÇÇ from the atmosphere and store it permanently.
description_metadata_raw: We‚Äôve created and deployed a solution that mineralizes CO‚ÇÇ in demolished concrete aggregate ‚Äì thus permanently removing the CO‚ÇÇ from the atmosphere.

company_updates.description:
Rock(s) on stage? ü™® Yes, that happened. And no, it wasn't a concert - let's rewind to our TEDx moment‚Ä¶ ü§òüèº

What looks like a mount of waste, or a pile of greyish rocks to many is, for Anna Haas, a heap of opportunity! üèóÔ∏è

At neustark, we see both: the opportunity ‚Äì and a powerhouse of a woman, driving the #decarbonization of the construction industry with full force!üíÉüèª

To limit global warming, we must drastically reduce emissions. üåø Even with deep cuts, some emissions will remain. And it's these residual emissions we need to address with carbon dioxide removal.

üìΩÔ∏è Watch the video below and find out how we can approach durable #CDR in our TEDxZurich talk. Psst, spoiler alert: by turning the world's largest waste stream, demolition concrete, into a carbon sink ‚Äì today! üåèüöÄ

And once again: hats off to Anna for your amazing performance. You rock! ü™®ü•≥

Last week, we showed you how we at neustark capture our biogenic CO2 at point source. But what happens next? üîç

To durably store CO2 in #mineral waste streams, it must be transported from its capture site to a nearby storage site. As transporting air-like gas is not very efficient, a better solution is needed. The answer? We liquefy the CO2 so it fits into our #isotainers üöö

üêù Let us show you how that's be(e)ing done...

Think of the CO2 as a swarm of bees, buzzing around at 20 ¬∞C and 1 bar. To make it transportable, we #compress the gas, just like bringing the bees closer together. They start buzzing even more, not happy about the increased #density. That's when we have compressed gas at a toasty 80 ¬∞C and 16 bar.üå°Ô∏è

However, to make the #CO2 transportable, we have to cool it down again, until it turns into a liquid, reducing its volume even more. Now picture the bees entering their hive, close together and content. Similarly, liquid CO2 is like the bees settled in the hive: compact and ready for transport at -25¬∞C and 16 bar! ‚ùÑÔ∏è

üí° It's time for a quick refresher on how neustark captures CO2 at the source!

To durably remove #CO2 from the atmosphere, we must first capture it. ü´ß Sounds easy, right? In practice, however, things are not quite so simple. So, let's take a deep dive into neustark's approach to point source capture...

We work with biogas partners to capture our biogenic CO2. Through a technical process called #biogas upgrading, CO2 gets separated from methane (CO2 makes up ~40-50% of the raw gas). üë®üî¨
¬†
Our #technology, installed at the existing plant, captures the CO2 offgas directly at its source ‚Äì instead of releasing it back into the atmosphere. üí® Due to the upstream processes, it's already vastly pure (~98%). This saves us time and energy vs. filtering CO2 out of the air (with a concentration of ~0,04%).

We then liquefy the CO2 on site for efficient transport to our nearby #storage plants, where it is permanently removed from the atmosphere! üîí

Et voil√†! That‚Äôs how we create decisive #negativeemissions to reach our #netzero goals. üåéüå±

¬´In meinem Beruf kann ich meine Affinit√§t f√ºr Technik und #Nachhaltigkeit zusammenbringen.¬ª üå±

Bei neustark setzen wir auf skalierbare L√∂sungen, um #CO2 dauerhaft aus der Atmosph√§re zu entfernen. M√∂glich machen diese echten #Negativemissionen unsere Ingenieur:innen, darunter Helena Wiemeyer und Laura-Louisa Zellweger, die unsere Technologie gemeinsam mit unseren Partnern vor Ort umsetzen. üöÄ

So treiben beide t√§glich #Kreislaufwirtschaft und #Dekarbonisierung im Bau voran und zeigen: Technikberufe sind nicht nur vielf√§ltig, sondern auch entscheidend f√ºr den #Klimaschutz. ‚ôªÔ∏è

Warum sich die beiden f√ºr diesen Berufsweg entschieden haben, erfahrt ihr im Artikel üëáüèº

Happy 6th birthday, neustark! ü•≥

Six years ago, our co-founders and co-CEOs Valentin Gutknecht and Johannes Tiefenthaler set out on a mission: to tackle #climate change with a pioneering solution. üå± Today, neustark is removing tonnes and tonnes of #CO2 from the atmosphere ‚Äì and storing it permanently through #mineralization.

üöÄ This is neustark. 

It's been six years of highs and lows, trial and error, building a #technology, and an industry, that didn't exist yet. None of this would've been possible without our incredible team: from Austria to Brazil, with educational backgrounds from mechanical engineering to commercial apprenticeships, and music tastes from hard rock to classical. What unites us all? A common #purpose and a whole lot of #teamspirit.

üß° That's neustark too. 

Let our team speak for itself. And who knows, you might just catch the spark! ‚ú®

[üé• by Dominic Kallen]

How can #CO2 be removed from the atmosphere ‚Äì and can we scale these technologies in time to reach #NetZero by 2050?

Carbon Dioxide Removal was long seen as a technology of the future. Today, it's a necessity if we want to meet the #climategoals. Lisa Braune puts it plainly: ¬´Most companies are still waiting to buy carbon removals, telling themselves, we still have time. But everyone needs to realize that if all companies do that, then we won't have any carbon removals in 2050.¬ª üå±

The latest episode of #NZZFormat dives deep into the emerging field of #carbonremoval ‚Äì featuring fascinating insights from Cyril Brunner and a closer look at the work of Swiss innovators neustark and Climeworks, as well as international CDR frontrunners Carbon Gap and Carbonfuture.

üé• Thank you, NZZ ‚Äì we‚Äôre proud to be part of this. Watch the full documentary on Youtube now (English subtitles included!) üëáüèºüëáüèºüëáüèº

https://loom.ly/UcLKYHw

What does it take to make #carbonremoval happen? 

Technological innovation, investment, policy ‚Äì of course all of that. But there's one key ingredient we can't do without...

An incredible team bringing our neustark vision to life and removing those tonnes! üß°

As always, we kicked off the quarter with our OKR session, aligning company priorities and setting ambitious goals to enable permanent #CO2 storage and removal for a bright future of all generations on our planet. üåçüå±

Our OKRs are not just about what we do, but also how we do it: as a #team. 

We wrapped up the day by the river, enjoying the summer vibes with our #colleagues from our hubs in Switzerland, France, Poland, Germany and UK. ü•≥

The next day, our new joiners headed out with Kevin Knecht to see our plants in action. There's no better way to understand our tech and #impact than seeing our solution up close! üöÄ

Achtung, dieser CO2-Tank hat eine Mission ‚Äì und sie beginnt in der Luft! Denn bevor wir CO2 dauerhaft aus der Atmosph√§re entfernen k√∂nnen, muss dieser schwebende Tank erst einmal sicher landen. ü´ß 
 
üèóÔ∏è Im Rheintal ist genau das passiert: Eine weitere CO2-Speicheranlage ist bei der saw gruppe in Widnau mit dem Kran angekommen ‚Äì und speichert dort nun t√§glich CO2 im #Betonrestwasser. 
  
Bis zu 150 Tonnen #CO2 k√∂nnen hier pro Jahr dauerhaft gebunden werden. Read all about our new multi-year agreement with Swiss International Air Lines ‚Äì the 1st (of hopefully many!) airlines to join forces with neustark. 

And how we're linking two #carbon-intensive industries ‚Äì #aviation‚úàÔ∏è and #constructionüèóÔ∏è ‚Äì to accelerate the commercialization of durable carbon removal, essential for reaching #netzero emissions.

As the St Helens Tower is demolished to make way for One Undershaft, soon to be the joint tallest building in the city, almost 49,000 tonnes of #concrete are set to be recycled. üèóÔ∏è

An important step and a reminder of an even greater potential: what if this material could not only be recycled, but also reused in London‚Äôs newest landmark, while at the same time serving as a durable #CO2 sink? ‚ôªÔ∏è

Across Europe, projects already demonstrate how recycled carbonated concrete aggregate #cRCA can become the foundation for new buildings and, through mineralization, lock away CO2 for good. With its scale and ambition, London has the opportunity to take a leading role in this transformation.

Our latest blog explores what needs to change if London is to take the lead in low-carbon, #circularconstruction üëâüèº https://loom.ly/saiEW5c

[üì∑ Images: DBOX, courtesy of Eric Parry Architects]

Looking for a #job in the climate space ‚Äì or know of someone?

We love this new blog by illuminem highlighting 60+ #sustainability and #ESG roles that shouldn't be missed: https://loom.ly/H88_ciM üíö

We love even more that a neustark job is included in the list üòâ A few more to highlight:

üìçAustria
üîó https://loom.ly/hK3X4C0

üíº Account Executive CDR

üîó https://loom.ly/dI8B-2o

Building and maintaining our CO2 capture & storage sites your cup of tea?
üíº Service Technician
üìçDACH region

üöÄ Als wir vor f√ºnf Jahren mit der Berliner Senatsverwaltung ins #CORE-Projekt gestartet sind, standen wir mit unserem ersten Prototypen erst am Anfang unserer Reise zur #Dekarbonisierung der Bauindustrie.

F√ºnf Jahre sp√§ter ist viel passiert:
‚úÖ neustark hat 39 aktive Abscheidungs- und Speicheranlagen in ganz Europa
‚úÖ Im Rahmen von CORE wurden Betone mit karbonatisierter #Gesteinsk√∂rnung zertifiziert und zugelassen
‚úÖ Es gab erste Pilotanwendungen von #RC-Beton
‚úÖ ‚Ä¶und jetzt der Sprung in den grossen Massstab: In der 3. Projektphase werden √ºber 12.000 m¬≥ karbonatisierter RC-Beton f√ºr den Neubau eines Museums verwendet!

Einzelne Rezepturen nutzen die aktuell geltenden Normen mit bis zu 45 % rezyklierter Gesteinsk√∂rnung vollst√§ndig aus. Was das bedeutet? Durch optimierte Rezepturen, #CO2-arme Zemente und karbonatisierte RC-Gesteinsk√∂rnungen wird das Geb√§ude zu einem Vorzeigeprojekt f√ºr nachhaltiges Bauen!

Wir freuen uns, mit unserer Technologie einen Beitrag zur #Bauwende zu leisten ‚Äì und blicken gespannt auf den Spatenstich 2026. üåç

We‚Äôre thrilled to partner up with Swiss International Air Lines ‚Äì our first aviation client ‚Äì to durably remove #CO2 in the next years. ‚úàÔ∏èüèóÔ∏è

SWISS, part of the Lufthansa Group, knows that a multi-faceted approach is needed to decarbonize and reach #netzero emissions by 2050. 

üå± And that that approach should also be a multi-technology one to enable the scale-up of #climate solutions: from durable #carbonremoval to #SAF. 

neustark is proud to be their new partner in removing residual emissions from the atmosphere by capturing biogenic CO2 and storing it via surface #mineralization in recycled mineral waste such as demolition concrete. üöÄ

Read more about our partnership: https://loom.ly/KpZjNQM

Rock(s) on stage? ü™® Yes, that happened. And no, it wasn't a concert - let's rewind to our TEDx moment‚Ä¶ ü§òüèº

What looks like a mount of waste, or a pile of greyish rocks to many is, for Anna Haas, a heap of opportunity! üèóÔ∏è

At neustark, we see both: the opportunity ‚Äì and a powerhouse of a woman, driving the #decarbonization of the construction industry with full force!üíÉüèª

To limit global warming, we must drastically reduce emissions. üåø Even with deep cuts, some emissions will remain. And it's these residual emissions we need to address with carbon dioxide removal.

üìΩÔ∏è Watch the video below and find out how we can approach durable #CDR in our TEDxZurich talk. Psst, spoiler alert: by turning the world's largest waste stream, demolition concrete, into a carbon sink ‚Äì today! üåèüöÄ

And once again: hats off to Anna for your amazing performance. You rock! ü™®ü•≥

Last week, we showed you how we at neustark capture our biogenic CO2 at point source. But what happens next? üîç

To durably store CO2 in #mineral waste streams, it must be transported from its capture site to a nearby storage site. As transporting air-like gas is not very efficient, a better solution is needed. The answer? We liquefy the CO2 so it fits into our #isotainers üöö

üêù Let us show you how that's be(e)ing done...

Think of the CO2 as a swarm of bees, buzzing around at 20 ¬∞C and 1 bar. To make it transportable, we #compress the gas, just like bringing the bees closer together. They start buzzing even more, not happy about the increased #density. That's when we have compressed gas at a toasty 80 ¬∞C and 16 bar.üå°Ô∏è

However, to make the #CO2 transportable, we have to cool it down again, until it turns into a liquid, reducing its volume even more. Now picture the bees entering their hive, close together and content. Similarly, liquid CO2 is like the bees settled in the hive: compact and ready for transport at -25¬∞C and 16 bar! ‚ùÑÔ∏è

üí° It's time for a quick refresher on how neustark captures CO2 at the source!

To durably remove #CO2 from the atmosphere, we must first capture it. ü´ß Sounds easy, right? In practice, however, things are not quite so simple. So, let's take a deep dive into neustark's approach to point source capture...

We work with biogas partners to capture our biogenic CO2. Through a technical process called #biogas upgrading, CO2 gets separated from methane (CO2 makes up ~40-50% of the raw gas). üë®üî¨
¬†
Our #technology, installed at the existing plant, captures the CO2 offgas directly at its source ‚Äì instead of releasing it back into the atmosphere. üí® Due to the upstream processes, it's already vastly pure (~98%). This saves us time and energy vs. filtering CO2 out of the air (with a concentration of ~0,04%).

We then liquefy the CO2 on site for efficient transport to our nearby #storage plants, where it is permanently removed from the atmosphere! üîí

Et voil√†! That‚Äôs how we create decisive #negativeemissions to reach our #netzero goals. üåéüå±

¬´In meinem Beruf kann ich meine Affinit√§t f√ºr Technik und #Nachhaltigkeit zusammenbringen.¬ª üå±

Bei neustark setzen wir auf skalierbare L√∂sungen, um #CO2 dauerhaft aus der Atmosph√§re zu entfernen. M√∂glich machen diese echten #Negativemissionen unsere Ingenieur:innen, darunter Helena Wiemeyer und Laura-Louisa Zellweger, die unsere Technologie gemeinsam mit unseren Partnern vor Ort umsetzen. üöÄ

So treiben beide t√§glich #Kreislaufwirtschaft und #Dekarbonisierung im Bau voran und zeigen: Technikberufe sind nicht nur vielf√§ltig, sondern auch entscheidend f√ºr den #Klimaschutz. ‚ôªÔ∏è

Warum sich die beiden f√ºr diesen Berufsweg entschieden haben, erfahrt ihr im Artikel üëáüèº

Happy 6th birthday, neustark! ü•≥

Six years ago, our co-founders and co-CEOs Valentin Gutknecht and Johannes Tiefenthaler set out on a mission: to tackle #climate change with a pioneering solution. üå± Today, neustark is removing tonnes and tonnes of #CO2 from the atmosphere ‚Äì and storing it permanently through #mineralization.

üöÄ This is neustark. 

It's been six years of highs and lows, trial and error, building a #technology, and an industry, that didn't exist yet. None of this would've been possible without our incredible team: from Austria to Brazil, with educational backgrounds from mechanical engineering to commercial apprenticeships, and music tastes from hard rock to classical. What unites us all? A common #purpose and a whole lot of #teamspirit.

üß° That's neustark too. 

Let our team speak for itself. And who knows, you might just catch the spark! ‚ú®

How can #CO2 be removed from the atmosphere ‚Äì and can we scale these technologies in time to reach #NetZero by 2050?

Carbon Dioxide Removal was long seen as a technology of the future. Today, it's a necessity if we want to meet the #climategoals. Lisa Braune puts it plainly: ¬´Most companies are still waiting to buy carbon removals, telling themselves, we still have time. But everyone needs to realize that if all companies do that, then we won't have any carbon removals in 2050.¬ª üå±

The latest episode of #NZZFormat dives deep into the emerging field of #carbonremoval ‚Äì featuring fascinating insights from Cyril Brunner and a closer look at the work of Swiss innovators neustark and Climeworks, as well as international CDR frontrunners Carbon Gap and Carbonfuture.

üé• Thank you, NZZ ‚Äì we‚Äôre proud to be part of this. Watch the full documentary on Youtube now (English subtitles included!) üëáüèºüëáüèºüëáüèº

https://loom.ly/UcLKYHw

What does it take to make #carbonremoval happen? 

Technological innovation, investment, policy ‚Äì of course all of that. But there's one key ingredient we can't do without...

An incredible team bringing our neustark vision to life and removing those tonnes! üß°

As always, we kicked off the quarter with our OKR session, aligning company priorities and setting ambitious goals to enable permanent #CO2 storage and removal for a bright future of all generations on our planet. üåçüå±

Our OKRs are not just about what we do, but also how we do it: as a #team. 

We wrapped up the day by the river, enjoying the summer vibes with our #colleagues from our hubs in Switzerland, France, Poland, Germany and UK. ü•≥

The next day, our new joiners headed out with Kevin Knecht to see our plants in action. There's no better way to understand our tech and #impact than seeing our solution up close! üöÄ

Achtung, dieser CO2-Tank hat eine Mission ‚Äì und sie beginnt in der Luft! Denn bevor wir CO2 dauerhaft aus der Atmosph√§re entfernen k√∂nnen, muss dieser schwebende Tank erst einmal sicher landen. ü´ß 
 
üèóÔ∏è Im Rheintal ist genau das passiert: Eine weitere CO2-Speicheranlage ist bei der saw gruppe in Widnau mit dem Kran angekommen ‚Äì und speichert dort nun t√§glich CO2 im #Betonrestwasser. 
  
Bis zu 150 Tonnen #CO2 k√∂nnen hier pro Jahr dauerhaft gebunden werden. Nicht schlecht, wenn man bedenkt, dass Betonrestwasser ein Abfallprodukt ist: Es entsteht bei der Reinigung von Betonmischern und enth√§lt einen hohen Anteil an Zementphasen. Genau dort wird durch #Mineralisierung das CO2 dauerhaft gebunden. üîí 
   
Danke an die saw gruppe f√ºr die starke Partnerschaft! Wir freuen uns, t√§glich eine positive #Klimawirkung zu erzielen und unser Netzwerk mit vielen weiteren Partnern zu erweitern.

TNW recently named 35 of Europe's hottest tech #scaleups ‚Äì and neustark is proud to represent #ClimateTech in this elite group üöÄ

And see you at next year's #TNWConference! üëã

üåç London Climate Action Week, it's been a pleasure!

In June, together with Supercritical and Holcim UK, we opened the doors to our #CO2 storage site in the heart of London ‚Äì making carbon removal tangible and showing what real climate #impact looks like on the ground.

From capturing biogenic CO2 to permanently storing it in recycled concrete aggregates (#RCA), our solution turns construction waste into a climate solution.

And of course, our duckling joined too! üê§ They keep traveling the world, spreading the word about durable #carbonremoval, one conversation at a time.

Thank you to everyone we met, for the meaningful discussions and shared drive to accelerate #decarbonization and scale #CDR ‚Äì together. Let‚Äôs keep going. üå±

¬´The best thing about working at neustark? Experiencing every phase of a fast-growing startup - from the first prototype to storing thousands of tonnes of #CO2.¬ª üöÄüå±

After completing his mechanical engineering studies with a focus on #sustainability and process engineering at ETH Z√ºrich, Luca Tschurtschenthaler joined neustark in 2020 as our very first intern - and employee #4. üë®üèºüîß

From day one, Luca played a key role in developing the CO2 storage #technology. Now, as Head of R&D, he leads our efforts to further optimize our tech and explore new ways to durably store CO2.

BlackRock spent a day with Luca to learn more about his journey, his work in the lab, and what drives his passion for #climate innovation.

Watch the video here üëáüèºüëáüèºüëáüèº [Video courtesy of BlackRock]

Looking back at our June highlights, the #carbonremoval partnership with SpareBank 1 S√∏r-Norge  was certainly high on the list!

Why? üîÅ 
Well, it'll be the first cross-border transfer of durable removal credits under Article 6 of the #ParisAgreement 

How? ü´±üèºü´≤üèΩ 
This pilot is grounded on the landmark agreement signed last month by Switzerland and Norway driving regulated, cross-border #CCS and #CDR 

What a major precedent for the ever-increasing importance of and transparency in permanent CO2 storage & removal! üí•

We're permanently storing CO2 in mineral waste streams, and we're doing it in Italy now too! üáÆüáπ As part of our strategic partnership, we're expanding our¬†#carbonremoval¬†technology to more and more¬†Holcim¬†sites across Europe.

Together, we're accelerating the¬†#decarbonization¬†of the construction industry - for a bright¬†#future¬†of all generations on our planet. Watch the video below to find out how!

Our today is your tomorrow. üåç

This year, neustark is joining #LCAW too, and we're looking forward to meeting familiar and new faces, engaging in meaningful discussions, and tackling climate change together.

Together, let's turn #climate strategies into concrete action. For a bright future of all generations on our planet. üöÄ

Neustark ü§ù SpareBank  üü∞ 1st international pilot transfer of durable carbon removal under #Article6 of the Paris Agreement! 

Today, Switzerland and Norway signed a milestone bilateral agreement to enable cross-border cooperation on #CCS and #CDR.  

üì¢ And first pilot activities were already launched: neustark is proud to partner with major Norwegian financial services provider SpareBank 1 to provide CDR generated in Switzerland.

What‚Äôs even more, these pilot transfers go in both directions and encompass a wide range of partners: Norwegian #BECCS developers Inherit and Carbon Centric are providing carbon removal to Swiss Post, Swiss International Air Lines, Swiss Re, UBS, Z√ºrcher Kantonalbank (via ClimeFi); the City of Zurich and IWB Industrielle Werke Basel (via Climeworks), and SIX (via Carbonfuture). 

üåç Together, we are shaping how #carbonremoval will work across borders ‚Äî proof that real climate progress happens when governments and private sector innovators join forces to turn ambition into action. 

Read more in our press release üëâ https://loom.ly/EvLsn3Q

üá®üá≠ü§ùüá≥üá¥ 

Two leading carbon capture, storage and removal countries join forces to boost #CCS and #CDR investments.

Alongside a business delegation including neustark's Valentin Gutknecht, Switzerland's Federal Councillor Albert R√∂sti is in Norway this week to discuss cross-border investments in CCS and #carbonremoval and sign a bilateral agreement.

This will enable the export and storage of Swiss carbon dioxide in Norway, as well as trade in negative emissions. 

Today, the group visited Northern Lights JV's impressive #CO2 transport and storage infrastructure in √òygarden.

Tomorrow... a world-first will be announcedüí°

Generalsekretariat GS-UVEK | Federal Office for the Environment FOEN |  Energidepartementet (Norge) | Terje Aasland | Andreas Bjelland Eriksen | Veronika Elgart | Tom Georg Indrevik | Jostein Borg Tegle

Am gleichen Ort biogenes CO2 abscheiden und direkt dauerhaft speichern? 
 
Unsere neuste Partnerschaft mit der Bereuter Gruppe im Kanton Z√ºrich macht es m√∂glich! 
 
Dank einer 50 Meter langen Gasleitung verbinden wir die Biogasanlage Volketswil (= #Abscheidung) üîó mit der neu in Betrieb genommenen CO2-Mineralisierungsanlage beim Baustoffrecycler Bereuter (= #Speicherung). 
 
Somit sparen wir uns die Verfl√ºssigung und den Transport des CO2 üí™

Diese lokale Partnerschaft zwischen Biogashersteller, Baurecycler und neustark macht CO2-Entfernung effizient! 
 
 üì∑ von der heutigen Einweihung in Anwesenheit von Beh√∂rden und Politikern
 
Danke vor allem an: Adrian Thomann Daniel Rensch Alan Meister Marcel Egloff

 #CCS #CDR #Dekarbonisierung #CarbonRemoval

Neustark explained in 30 seconds? Say no more.

Dirk Klee, BlackRock‚Äôs Country Head for Switzerland, visited the site of alluvia Gruppe and Vigier Beton in Biberist (near Berne) to see firsthand how carbon #emissions are turned into recycled #concrete. ‚ôªÔ∏è

Watch our co-founder Valentin break down how we turn the world's largest waste stream, #construction demolition waste, into a #carbon sink. üëáüèº

(Yes, we timed it. And yes, it‚Äôs a new record. üòâ)

Video courtesy of BlackRock.

With London Climate Action Week around the corner, no better time for a throwback to late 2024, when we launched our first CO2 storage & removal site in the UK. üí™

Operated by Holcim UK, the demonstration site is located in the one of the world's biggest urban mines: London. In Greenwich, demolition concrete is crushed, filtered and recycled for further use ‚Äì and also carbonated. 

üí°How it works: Biogenic #CO2 is captured nearby and transported to the storage site, where it is injected into the recycled aggregate, and ‚Äì via our accelerated mineralization technology ‚Äì bound to the pores and surface of the granules. And thus stored permanently, for thousands of years. ü™® 

With the carbonated recycled concrete aggregate (cRCA), Holcim produces more circular building materials ‚Äì that also act as a carbon sink!

This is only the beginning... We are currently expanding our impact across the UK and beyond, scaling our #carbonremoval solution, hand-in-hand with our partners decarbonizing the #construction sector. üåè

üóûÔ∏è Read more here: https://loom.ly/qU1o_4I

#Beton ist das Fundament unserer modernen Infrastruktur. Doch auch wenn es Alternativen gibt, k√∂nnen sie die riesigen Mengen, die wir weltweit ben√∂tigen, (noch) nicht ersetzen. 

Deshalb m√ºssen wir (Abbruch-)Beton anders denken ‚Äì und klimafreundlicher machen. Genau da setzt neustark an. ‚ôªÔ∏è

"Wir haben bei vielen #Betonproduzenten gesehen, dass sie Auffangbecken f√ºr das Wasser aus der Reinigung der #Betonmischer haben. Dieses Wasser enth√§lt #Zement ‚Äì und wir haben getestet, ob sich auch hier #CO2 dauerhaft speichern l√§sst", so co-CEO Johannes Tiefenthaler. üîí

Was dabei herauskam ‚Äì und wie das Ganze funktioniert ‚Äì zeigt der neue Beitrag von Terra Mater Studios auf ServusTV (ab 16:47).

üëáüèºüì∫ https://loom.ly/rMpKX9Y

Buongiorno, Italia! üáÆüáπ

Our European expansion continues to gain momentum - and we‚Äôre proud to take the next step together with¬†Holcim¬†and its local teams across the continent as we work to¬†#decarbonize¬†the built environment. üöÄüå±

After successfully entering the French and Austrian markets earlier this year, we're now excited to commission 3 new CO2 storage plants for¬†#concrete¬†residual water in Italy, in partnership with¬†Holcim (Italia) SpA.

All facilities are located just a few kilometers from Milan - another significant milestone in our mission to permanently store and remove¬†#CO2, one site at a time. üìà

Question: What happens when 12 neustarkers plus 2 honorary alumni swap #carbonremoval for sweat, sneakers, and sprints to the summit?

Answer: They smash the #SolaStafette, a giant 115km + 2640m of elevation relay race in Zurich, and finish 170th out of 1000+ teams, beating last year's time by a whopping 40 minutes.üí•

Some honorary (metaphoric) medals go to:

üéñÔ∏è Armand, our fastest neustarker, flying at a 4:18/km pace for nearly an hour,
üéñÔ∏è Luca, who crushed the Uetliberg mountain stretch and ranked #21 of 1106 participants,
üéñÔ∏è Elmar, Lisa, Luis (incl. üêï!), Donato, and Helena for showing up year after year to fly the neustark colors,
üéñÔ∏è Simon & Benedikt, who may have moved on work-wise, but clearly still run on CDR energy üß°,
üéñÔ∏è and to this year's race new joiners Sophia, Kevin, Michael, Valentin, Johannes who kept a smile on their faces throughout the strain!

Who wouldn't trust a team with this much joy and endurance for a shared mission? üí™ 

Let's keep running, reducing and #removing to the max! üåéüå±

company_updates.reshared_post_description:
At neustark, we permanently store CO2 by injecting it into mineral waste, such as demolished #concrete.
Our tech trigger an accelerated #mineralization process, where the CO2 is turned into limestone in the recycled construction aggregate. The CO2 is locked away for good - and the recycled and now carbonated aggregate is reused in #construction.
¬†
My co-founder Valentin Gutknecht shows how it's done at the storage site of our partner alluvia Gruppe and Vigier Beton:
üîπ from demolished concrete at a former paper mill
üîπ to mineralizing the #CO2 at our storage plant
üîπto carbonated recycled concrete aggregate (#RCA)
üîπ and back into new roads and buildings
¬†
Our plants store around 1,000 tonnes of CO2 per year - that‚Äôs roughly what 50,000 fir trees would remove from the atmosphere in the same time.
¬†
Learn how we - together with parners like BlackRock - are permanently storing and removing CO2 and helping to #decarbonize the construction industry.

https://lnkd.in/dJePEg8W

1Ô∏è‚É£ H√∂here Druckfestigkeit: Die Karbonatisierung erh√∂ht die Festigkeit des Recyclingbetons und damit auch die Tragf√§higkeit und Langlebigkeit. ü™®

Karbonatisierte Gesteinsk√∂rnungen (#RC-Beton), stehen herk√∂mmlichem Beton in nichts nach. Unsere Recycler profitieren von hochwertigen, nachhaltigen Baustoffen ‚Äì und einem klaren #Wettbewerbsvorteil.

The German Parliament has a historic bill this week, unlocking massive funding to support climate economic transformation measures.

üí∞ 100 billion euros will be invested in #climate transformation over the next 12 years. That‚Äôs incredible news! 

Now, it's time to turn strategies into tangible climate action ‚Äì and ensure that we build the infrastructure needed to capture, store and remove residual CO2.

It's time to #ThinkNegative.

Germany, as many other countries with clear #netzero targets, is facing a unique opportunity: We can develop #negativeemissions (i.e. carbon removal) into a key technology for both the economy and the climate. üöÄ

The #CCS and #CDR industry can become the backbone of a future-proof, climate-friendly economy: creating new markets, new jobs, sustainable growth, and a bright future of all generations on our planet. üåéüåø

Let's continue scaling #carbonremoval together ‚Äì and set a set a decisive course for the future.

Welcome to the team, Marco Mazzotti üëãüèº

Marco boasts unique expertise in developing carbon dioxide capture & storage systems. He holds many hats üé©: from professor of process engineering at ETH Z√ºrich to scientific advisor, project lead and author, working alongside the IPCC, industry players, research experts and associations on #CCS and #CDR.

We are super excited to have Marco join as Chief Scientist to further propel permanent storage solutions for residual CO2, including geological storage. üöÄ 

Neustark's expertise lies in accelerated surface #mineralization of mineral waste like demolition concrete ‚Äì but storing CO2 in the sub-surface has massive potential to help achieve our #netzero goals. üåø

"As a company specializing in capturing and durably storing CO2 via mineralization, we need and want to contribute to exploring this potential ‚Äì all whilst, of course, continuing to scale our solution of working with #recyclers to store CO2 in construction demolition waste," as our co-CEO Johannes Tiefenthaler puts it.

Visit our website to read more: https://loom.ly/j50iUQ8

When CO2 and calcium meet, CO2 turns to rock ü™® 

That's what we do at neustark, simply put: permanent storage of CO2 via surface #mineralization.

Here's a crash course into the chemistry üî¨üí•

‚ùÑÔ∏è Endothermic reactions require energy. Think of photosynthesis: sunlight is needed to turn #CO2 into glucose. üå±  Just as plants need energy from the sun, endothermic reactions need an input of energy.

üî• Exothermic reactions release energy. Our #CO2storage process is a perfect example: a plant storing 500 kg of CO2 per hour has an energy release of 550 kW. That would be enough energy to power 45 electric cars cruising at 60 km/h! üöó However, since this energy is in the form of low heat (~40¬∞C), it's not easy to make practical use of it.

While our process might not heat your office, it‚Äôs a powerhouse for our #carbonremoval process. üîí Reversing the reaction to release the CO2 again would require the same amount of energy, so >600¬∞C, which is highly unlikely.

neustark's process stores CO2 in mineral waste for thousands of years with a negligible risk of reversal. That's what we call durably capturing, storing and removing CO2 from the atmosphere üí™üåç

Holcim UK might be the new name in UK #construction, but they're certainly not new to the game!

And neither is their commitment to expanding the uptake of #sustainable building materials in the UK ‚Äì a goal we share.  

Did you know:
üî∏ 1/3 of their current turnover comes from sustainable products, growing steadily

üöõ From 1 to 3: our partner is upgrading!

ara region bern ag was our neustark's very first CO2 capture partner and has been a cornerstone of our journey from the start. Today, as CO2 valorization proves to be a profitable and impactful business model, ara bern is taking bold steps to expand its #capture and liquefaction plant. Here's what's new:

ü´ß Expanded capacity: The upgraded plant will process almost all of the #CO2 generated - up to 6,000 tonnes per year (that's an increase of 4,500 tonnes).

üëã Bye-bye, misleading environmental claims by businesses and products

EU institutions are working on the final text of the #GreenClaimsDirective, a key regulation aimed at combating greenwashing by setting stringent requirements for climate-related claims.

Neustark & our peers from Negative Emissions Platform urge the EU to ensure that the Directive provides clear requirements for corporate climate claims and facilitates the much-needed investments in permanent #carbonremoval.

üçÉ  Compensation claims need to be allowed before the net zero point
‚ñ∂Ô∏è The Directive must clarify how companies can claim emissions compensation before reaching #netzero ‚Äì as long as they progress on their decarbonization path. A too rigid approach risks the crucial scale-up of negative emissions technologies.

üçÉ  ‚ÄúLike-for-like‚Äù CO2 storage needs to be enshrined in EU law
‚ñ∂Ô∏è Fossil emissions must be offset with permanent removals to achieve long-term climate integrity. No if's and but's.

üçÉ  Only high-quality, ex-post carbon removal credits should be allowed
‚ñ∂Ô∏è For their claims, companies should only use retired removal credits, avoiding reliance on future projects that may not materialise.

By setting clear and science-based rules on climate claims, the GCD can protect consumers from #greenwashing while accelerating investments in permanent CDR and boosting real climate action.

Read the full letter here: https://bit.ly/4i69GEZ

CO2 certificates: A win-win for the planet and the developer

75 tonnes of permanently stored #CO2 ‚Äì that‚Äôs not only good for the climate but also for the project owner! In the new building complex in Zurich, all concrete structures (except precast elements) are made of carbonated #RC concrete, produced and supplied by KIBECO. ‚ôªÔ∏è

But who gets to claim the #climate benefit? There are two ways of dealing with the certificate. In the case of the Bellis project in Effretikon (ZH), the Bereuter Gruppe chose to claim the climate benefit of this innovative construction method and assign it to the building project. üåøüèóÔ∏è

How does it work exactly? And what are the alternatives? Find the answers in our case study üëâüèº https://loom.ly/Bh7qvdU
